Posts.Content: LizL wrote: Johnson and Johnson says they are going to market a new blood test that could be used to evaluate the effectiveness of chemotherapy, as well as being a diagonistic tool. http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/40881967/ns/health-cancer How would a person go about getting into one of the trials? My sister just completed months of chemo for triple negative BC, and her mastectomies are scheduled for next week. It sounds like this new test might be a good idea for her to do between surgery and starting radiation. I wonder if some people could skip or cut down on radiation if such a blood test did not find circulating cancer cells. Log in to post a reply
